page.title: 03FOWLIS EASTER VILLAGE
page.content: Fowlis is a small village situated approximately one and one quarter km. north of the A85 Trunk road to Perth.It consists of a church,castle,school,old mill,smithy and a few houses.In the past Fowlis was heavily populated but it is now occupied by families who commute to Dundee and pensioners. The school is due to be closed summer 1985 because of the lack of pupils. The site of the old church dates from 1142 but the church itself was not built until 1453 and boasts of being one of the oldest in Scotland. The castle built in 1640 was formally much larger but has recently been renovated.
